channel.title: Spring 2020 Portfolio SDS 348
channel.description: Recent content on Spring 2020 Portfolio SDS 348

item.title: Python Post
item.description: I really enjoyed getting to better develop my skills in R this semester. It was also interesting getting to learn a little bit of the Python language. I was pleasantly surprised to learn that R and python can interact and both be used together in RStudio. Below are some examples of python code, and really simple instances of R and python interacting. library(reticulate) Sys.setenv(RETICULATE_PYTHON = "/usr/bin/python/") use_python("usr/bin/python") #install.packages("reticulate") library(reticulate) #this is a python code chunk me_dict = { 'firstName': 'Casey', 'lastName': 'David', 'hobbies': ['playlist making', 'road trips', 'hiking', 'running'], 'age' : 22 } print(me_dict) ## {'lastName': 'David', 'age': 22, 'firstName': 'Casey', 'hobbies': ['playlist making', 'road trips', 'hiking', 'running']} This example was me creating a dictionary entry for myself with some information about myself.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some projects that I have worked on this semester: Exploratory Data Analysis using Tidyverse Tools Modeling, Testing, and Classification

item.title: Project 2 -- SDS 348
item.description: The dataset that I have chosen to use for this project is the ‘baseball’ dataset that is in the ‘vcd’ package. I chose this dataset because I have spent most of my life hearing my Dad and 2 older brothers talk about baseball; all three of them are able to rattle off random statistics from numerous years and numerous players. I thought this would be an interesting dataset to work with since I understand the game (and I thought it might help me earn some points with my family).
